item.Question: Australian Aborigines are indigenous people of Australia whose ancestors came from Asia at least 50,000 years ago. By the time Europeans began settling Australia in 1788, Aborigines had occupied the entire continent and had adapted successfully to Australia's often harsh climatic conditions.
